title: How to Make Carrot and Sultana Scones

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 200°C (390°F), or gas mark 6.
Sift the flour and baking powder into a large bowl.
Stir in the sugar, carrots, sultanas and pumpkin seeds.
Make a space in the center of the mixture and pour in the milk and vanilla extract.
Use a table knife to bring the mixture together so that it forms a firm dough.
steps.description: If the dough is not firm enough add a small amount of flour.

steps.headline: Put the dough mixture onto a flat surface and gently roll or pat it out to a thickness of about 2cm and using a 6cm cutter, stamp out 8 rounds.
Put the unbaked scones onto a non-stick baking tray or a tray covered in baking paper.
Brush the top of the unbaked scones with some of the milk.
Put into the oven and bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until risen and golden.
Leave the cooked scones on a wire rack to cool before serving.

text: Preheat your oven to 200°C (390°F), or gas mark 6.  Sift the flour and baking powder into a large bowl.  Stir in the sugar, carrots, sultanas and pumpkin seeds.  Make a space in the center of the mixture and pour in the milk and vanilla extract.  Use a table knife to bring the mixture together so that it forms a firm dough. If the dough is not firm enough add a small amount of flour. Put the dough mixture onto a flat surface and gently roll or pat it out to a thickness of about 2cm and using a 6cm cutter, stamp out 8 rounds.  Put the unbaked scones onto a non-stick baking tray or a tray covered in baking paper.  Brush the top of the unbaked scones with some of the milk.  Put into the oven and bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until risen and golden.  Leave the cooked scones on a wire rack to cool before serving.  Finished.
